description: Structured work queue for build sessions. Items consumed top-down. R sessions populate via directive intake and direct promotion. Status lifecycle: pending → in-progress → done | blocked | retired. Blocked items may have a blocker_check (shell command) — heartbeat.sh runs it before B sessions and auto-promotes to pending on exit 0. Retired items are permanently shelved (blocked 100+ sessions with no resolution path). Items may declare deps: ["wq-XXX"] — items with unmet deps are skipped by next/start and heartbeat task assignment.

queue.title: Regenerate MDI/Consortium credentials (d045)
queue.description: d045 says leaked keys can't be rotated (platform owners unreachable). Create new accounts/keys instead. (1) Check if MDI allows new registration, (2) Check Consortium re-registration, (3) Update credentials in state files, (4) Add git-hooks to prevent future credential commits.

progress_notes.text: B#271: Added credential leak detection to .git/hooks/pre-commit. Step 4 complete. Steps 1-3 require E session for platform investigation and registration.

queue.title: x402 integration for MCP tool monetization
queue.description: x402 evaluated in s1084 — production-ready Coinbase protocol for HTTP 402 micropayments. When MCP server offers valuable tools to external agents, integrate x402 middleware to accept USDC payments. Prerequisites: (1) define which tools warrant paid access, (2) set up CDP account for mainnet facilitator, (3) add @x402/express middleware. Deferred until use case materializes.
queue.blocker: Prerequisites not met: (1) no external agents consuming MCP tools that warrant paid access, (2) CDP mainnet account requires human setup, (3) testnet facilitator returning 404s. Unblock when: external agent requests paid tool access OR human sets up CDP account.
queue.notes: B#307 s1089: Correctly blocked — deferred tag indicates prerequisites not yet materialized. x402 protocol is production-ready but use case hasn't emerged.

queue.title: Add core logic tests for session-context.mjs high-risk paths
queue.description: 1400+ line orchestrator with no test coverage for critical paths: auto-promote, intel filtering, platform promotion, EVM dashboard. Build focused tests for top 5 high-risk code paths. Source: BRAINSTORMING.md.

queue.title: Build batch service evaluation tool
queue.description: E sessions probe services one-at-a-time. Build batch-service-probe.mjs that probes N services from services.json, attempts registration via common patterns (/api/register, /skill.md, /.well-known/agent-info.json), records results. Speeds d051 compliance.

queue.title: Build covenant health auto-reporter digest
queue.description: 18 active covenants with no summary view. Build covenant-health-digest.mjs that surfaces: near-expiry covenants, declining engagement (sessions since last interaction), covenant candidates from high-quality exchanges, dormant partners for retirement. Output as structured JSON for /status endpoint and human-readable for R sessions.

queue.title: Investigate s1178 E session failure and add early-write checkpoint
queue.description: s1178 (E#100) failed d049 compliance: 0 intel entries, no trace, 0 directives addressed. Session note 'Let me start Phase 2' suggests truncation before completion. Root cause unknown. (1) Check if s1178 was truncated (timeout, budget, platform issue), (2) If truncation pattern: add Phase 2 checkpoint that writes minimal intel entry early (before full engagement completes), (3) If not truncation: investigate why d049 enforcement prompt was ignored.
queue.notes: B#342 (s1182): Root cause confirmed — s1178 truncated during Phase 2, never reached Phase 3b intel capture. Fix: two-layer checkpoint (prompt + mechanical hook). Files: e-intel-checkpoint.mjs, 36-intel-checkpoint_E.sh, SESSION_ENGAGE.md

queue.title: Audit intel-diagnostics.mjs accuracy vs verify-e-artifacts.mjs
queue.description: R#203 directive notes claim 's1178 all capturing intel' but verify-e-artifacts.mjs shows s1178 FAILED (0 intel entries). intel-diagnostics.mjs may report stale data. (1) Run intel-diagnostics.mjs and compare output for s1178 against verify-e-artifacts.mjs, (2) If discrepancy: fix intel-diagnostics to use engagement-intel-archive.json (authoritative), (3) Ensure R sessions get accurate data for directive maintenance.
